posts.name:
üì± Zach Barney
üì± Zach Barney
posts.content:
Today is day 1 of the Mobly company kickoff. So excited to reflect a little on how we got here and spend a whole ton of time on where we are going!

One of my favorite traditions we do is havedress up as his alter-ego, Mr. Mobly and hand out our team-voted superlatives. Similar to Dwight Shrute's Recyclops, he takes it to a new level each time.

This year he is wearing a Harry Christmas orange tux from Dumb & Dumber and using a ChatGPT-generated Stefon-style monologue to present each award.

My personal favorite superlative this year is for, who was voted "Most Likely to Miss The Kickoff Due to Forgetting About an Out of Country Scuba Diving Trip" (yes....this is a recurring thing...)

What's the best superlative you've ever seen/received?
posts.commentAdded: What a fun tradition! Love the creativity with Mr. Moblys presentations. Most Likely to Miss The Kickoff sounds classic! üåü

posts.name:
Cliff K. Locks
Cliff K. Locks
posts.content:
Feeling frustrated with rejection? It‚Äôs not the world‚Äôs fault‚Äîit‚Äôs a mirror.

Young men, understand this: women have every right to be selective. If you were in their position, wouldn‚Äôt you be? So, take rejection not as an insult but as a challenge to grow.

Ô∏è Are you presenting your best self?
Ô∏è Are you educated, driven, and goal-oriented?
Ô∏è Do you have a plan for your future?

Invest in yourself first, and the rest will follow. Growth attracts opportunity.



Your repost could inspire someone to start their journey of self-improvement. Thank you for sharing!
posts.commentAdded: Great perspective! Embracing rejection as a growth opportunity is crucial. Investing in ourselves truly leads to new possibilities. üí™‚ú®

posts.name:
Katie Patterson
Katie Patterson
posts.content:
Know your numbers. Know your expenses down to the penny, know your exact sales needed to hit your goal, and revisit the overview every week. It will completely transform your business. It's (unfortunately), in my experience working with so many companies over the years, the norm for business leaders and entrepreneurs to *not* know this information. They believe their bookkeeper / CPA knows it. That might be the case, but you need to know them, too to make better decisions.

I created this template to guide entrepreneurs through this process:
posts.commentAdded: Great insight! Mastering your numbers is crucial for informed decision-making. Thanks for sharing your template to empower entrepreneurs!

posts.name:
Kim Doll, PMP, CSM
Kim Doll, PMP, CSM
posts.content:
After a period of regrouping with family following my layoff in May, I am now fully prepared and eager to re-enter the workforce.‚Äç‚ÄçÔ∏è 

I am actively seeking opportunities in Project Management, where I can bring my extensive experience across Technology (AI, Machine Learning, Automation), Media & Entertainment, EdTech, Restaurant & Automotive Technology, and Consulting. My core strengths include:

- Developing Process Frameworks that drive operational excellence.
- Mentoring Teams to boost productivity and performance.
- Leading Enterprise Initiatives to deliver measurable, data-driven results.
- Driving Change Initiatives that improve process adoption and employee engagement.

I am looking to connect with professionals for informational interviews, job opportunities, or networking. If you or someone in your network can assist, I‚Äôd love to hear from you!

IDEAL ROLES
Remote full-time or part-time positions leading projects and teams.

INDUSTRIES OF INTEREST
Technology-driven companies, especially in AI, machine learning, automation, or innovative solutions.
||||||||

HIGHLIGHTED ACHIEVEMENTS
- Led global teams of 40+ employees to implement an EV Dealer Partner Program.
- Deployed a global payroll system by aligning IT, HR, and Payroll departments.
- Established a Project Management Office (PMO) to enhance delivery efficiency.
- Improved PCI Compliance, reducing risk and ensuring adherence to industry standards.

SKILLS
- Project Management: Agile, Waterfall, Lean Six Sigma.
- Technology Platforms: ATS, Oracle, Azure AD, Workday, POS Systems
- Specialized Expertise: Compliance, Process Improvement, Change Management
- Soft Skills: Communication, Collaboration, Strategic Thinking

CONTACT INFORMATION
|

If you know someone in human resources, technology, education, or restaurant industries, please feel free to pass this along. I deeply appreciate your support and look forward to connecting and building something incredible together. 

CALL TO ACTION
- Please comment or like this post to spread the message!
- Let me know how I can use my network to assist you.

Special Thanks: A huge shoutout to Emily Worden  for her invaluable career coaching insight!

Open to Work - Google Docs

comments.commentText: Kim is a natural leader in her expertise as a Project Manager. I worked alongside her for several months on the most extremely fast-paced projects launching in the automotive world. Kim is very organized, follows through on everything (even the little things), and holds anyone and everyone accountable. If anyone has the chance to work with Kim they will be pleased with her work ethic and knowledge. Nothing will stop her from understanding the most complex items!!
Angie Beauchamp, MBA Thanks so much Angie! It was fun working with you as well.

posts.commentAdded: Excited to see your journey ahead! Your diverse expertise in project management will surely lead to amazing opportunities. Let‚Äôs connect!

posts.name:
Ned Arick
Ned Arick
posts.content:
Revenue leadership isn‚Äôt about hitting numbers, it‚Äôs about building a system that makes hitting numbers inevitable.

Anyone can push deals to close.

Anyone can slash prices to hit target.

But real revenue leaders create sustainable growth by:

 Building predictable, repeatable systems

 Coaching teams to improve conversions

 Aligning marketing, sales, and customer success (NO SILOS)

 Making data driven decisions, not gut calls

Short term thinking drives revenue spikes.

Long term leadership drives revenue engines.

Which one are you building?

comments.commentText:
Yes yes yes what gets measured, gets managed. 

I advocate for using a central source of truth like Hubspot - get everybody trained & fully on board with using all the important features, from pipeline management to sequences, notes to tasks.

Everybody should be on the "chassis" as we call it.

Use $8/hr offshore teams to clean up the mess everybody makes during the day. So we wake up in the morning and Hubspot is totally hygienic.

We get extreme clarity on our sales motion & daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, yearly goals.

Then we go for it.

Our system is built entirely around maximizing operating cash flow.
Dude this comment is better than my post! This is a masterclass Jesse Stein
Kyle Shannon NC to the moon!!

posts.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Sustainable growth is the key. Building systems and fostering collaboration truly sets great leaders apart. #RevenueLeadership

posts.name:
Michael Kainatsky
Michael Kainatsky
posts.content:
The best job I‚Äôve ever had is really shitty. 


I work 7 days a week, sometimes, 24 hours without a break.

The boss was always screaming and complaining.

There was no appreciation whatsoever, now it‚Äôs better.

Working conditions almost always stunk, but improved.

Here‚Äôs a rare picture of me at the office.

I love fatherhood, but most importantly

I really enjoy being a dad.

7k+ diapers changed and counting.

When they‚Äôre done, I will miss this period profoundly.

It‚Äôs cliche and is too often said, but it‚Äôs true.

The time goes fast, don‚Äôt rush it.

Yours truthfully,

comments.commentText:
Your journey highlights the resilience many of us share. Balancing work challenges with the joy of fatherhood is truly inspiring!  
hashtag
#WorkLifeBalance

This speaks to me so much. Being a first time parent was hard and I felt like I didn‚Äôt get to enjoy my daughter enough as a baby. I try to enjoy it more with my son. I wish I could go back three years to tell myself to enjoy it. So yes. Completely agree!
I am sure you're doing complex trig and I am still figuring out algebra 1. And trust me, any wives that speak to me dont make it easy on their husbands. But I think I got the better end of the deal!

posts.commentAdded: Thanks for sharing your journey! It‚Äôs inspiring to see how you‚Äôve embraced the challenges and joys of both work and fatherhood. Keep thriving!

posts.content: We discuss "pariah countries" or "failed states" all the time. We do so only for small countries. What is the world's most powerful country acted and smelled like a pariah?
